text: {{Infobox writer | image = | imagesize = | name = Myles Munroe | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Grand Bahama, Bahamas | death_date = November 9, 2014 (aged 60) | death_place = Grand Bahama, Bahamas | occupation = Pastor, Author,lecturer, teacher, leadership mentor, life coach and a government consultant | nationality = Bahamian | genre = Inspirational / Motivational Speaker | subject = | movement = | signature = | website = }} Myles Munroe, (20 April 1954 â€“ 9 November 2014) was a Bahamian Evangelical Christian evangelist and ordained Pentecostal minister. He founded and led the Bahamas Faith Ministries International (BFMI) and Myles Munroe International (MMI). Munroe also wrote many books about his faith. Munroe died with his wife, daughter, and 6 others in a private plane crash on 9 November 2014, aged 60.Liberty Voice; by Alimi Teniola - November 9, 2014 ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Aviation deaths Category:Bahamian people Category:Christian clergy Category:Pentecostals Category:North American writers
